pros: Great benefits, advancement opportunities, & growing practice
Lots of different Opportunities to learn form different specialties if you are willing to learn.
cons: Pay is too low for the work that is expected

pros: They do have a good 401K if you can last long enough to be in it.
cons: The CEO is a monster, she is so out of touch with anything that goes on. Due to her behavior, the management team just tries to survive and not rock the boat, so there is no one who is looking out for employee's. From what I understand it was a great place to work before the current CEO took over. I have been told so many stories of how she lies about employees to protect herself which is sad.

pros: Good 401K and you do get a free hamburger each year.
cons: Admin is out of touch with staff.  Unless you are friends with someone in admin you have no chance of advancement.  Company will bring in friends when there are more qualified staff currently working.

pros: Friendly atmosphere nice environment well ventilated and efficient workspace. Really enjoyed the experience and also enjoy the teamwork always displayed towards me.
cons: Upper management not friendly or even welcoming. Everyone knows they are replaceable workout getting told so a daily routine to encourage someone to work.

review_title: Poor management and supervisor communication skills
pros: Great starting pay and some benefits no vision coverage.
cons: Management runs like a highschool. Poor communication. No team work ethics. Coworkers talk about others behind their backs and management is part of it as well.

pros: Great place to start a career in healthcare
cons: Not a lot of room for advancement.  Once you are in a position, it is difficult to move up.

review_title: CEO is clueless with zero appreciation for employees
job_title: Director of Operations in Shreveport, LA
cons: CEO is a micro manager. Running the place into the ground. Has had 8 different administrative assistants and 4 different Director of Facilities since taking over 4 years ago. Pass this place up!
